clinical_study.brief_title: Point-of-Care RBC Washing to Prevent Transfusion-Related Pulmonary Complications
clinical_study.official_title: Point-of-Care RBC Washing to Prevent Transfusion-Related Pulmonary Complications

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to determine if point-of-care washing of allogeneic Leukocyte-Reduced Red Blood Cells reduces pulmonary complications when compared to standard-of-care Leukocyte-Reduced Red Blood Cells in a cardiac surgical population.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Developement of Transfusion Related Acute Lung Injury / Transfusion Associated Circulatory Overload
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to hospital day 28 or hosptial discharge, whichever comes first

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to hosptial day 28, or discharge, whichever comes first

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age equal to or greater than 18 years of age.
- Scheduled to have cardiac bypass surgery at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN or Duke University Medical Center in Raleigh, NC
- At risk for needing at least 4 units of blood during/after surgery
